Package com.ptc.windchill.enterprise.navigation.breadcrumb

This package contains most of the core classes that create the navigation bread crumbs displayed at the top of many Windchill pages.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BreadCrumbDelegate
    Interface for all BreadCrumbDelegates.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractBreadCrumbGenerator
    Abstract crumb generator class.

Package com.ptc.windchill.enterprise.navigation.breadcrumb Description

This package contains most of the core classes that create the navigation bread crumbs displayed at the top of many Windchill pages.

The bread crumb list is generated by an AJAX call to the BreadCrumbController. The controller creates the crumbs by calling the getCrumbs() method of an AbstractBreadCrumbGenerator subclass. Different subclasses of AbstractBreadCrumbGenerator may be used for different pages, based on the URL of the page.

Each generator class is defined as an inner class of a corresponding BreadCrumbDelegate class. The delegate class knows which pages the generator can handle and can return an instance of the generator class to the controller.

The controller locates the correct delegate class for any given page using the BreadCrumbDelegateFactory. The factory maintains a static list of delegate instances. When the controller calls the factory's getBreadCrumbDelegate() method, it loops through its list of available delegates, in order of priority, and calls the canHandle() method of each. When it finds a delegate that gives an affirmative response, it returns that delegate to the controller and the controller then asks the delegate for a new instance of its generator class. If no other delegate claims a given page, the FolderedBreadCrumbDelegate will be used.

See the Windchill Customizer's Guide for information about creating new BreadCrumbDelegates.
